inclusion.criterion: pre-operative BPH and/or erectile dysfunction medical treatment
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: pre-operative PSA, transabdominal ultrasound sizing of the prostate, serum creatinine and hemoglobin, urinalysis and culture, cystoscopy findings including the anatomical distribution of prostatic adenomas
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: neurogenic lower urinary tract dysfunction (Neurogenic Bladder)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: not competent to give consent and/or inability to provide answers to the questionnaire
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patient who refuse to participate in the study
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients who have a large prostate (more than 120 g on trans-abdominal ultrasound prostate sizing)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients who have renal impairment secondary to BPH
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients with proven or suspicion of prostate cancer based on clinical examination and/or PSA level
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: patients with refractory hematuria secondary to BPH
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients with history of pelvic radiotherapy
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 55 year old man visiting his primary care physician for lower urinary tract symptoms. Further evaluation revealed IPSS score : 15, Post-void residual: 70 mL, Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) level: 3.2 ng/mL.
